forum.name: hangout
forum.description: a board to relax and discuss all kinds of miscellaneous topics. welcome!

comments.text: it'd be a much more friendly community if people were asked to stop or leave instead of being instantly locked. it doesn't happen to me only it happens to a lot of newbies too.
amen. it doesn't help that i personally am not good at knowing when i'm making people upset, and tend to rely on people telling me when i'm doing something they don't like; [...]
otherwise i naturally assume everything is fine. *another* thing that certainly doesn't help--this one not just for me personally--is how utterly terrible anyland is when it [...]
comes to reaching out to people. if they happen to be in an area you can't access, you'll have to ping them, which is one of the most misleading and unreliable modes of [...]
contact i have seen. when you send a ping, it may say it sent, but you have no way of actually knowing for sure unless they respond. in fact, it's set up so by default they [...]
*won't* get your ping--yes, this feature working as you want it to is the exception, not the rule. unless they have pings on--*and* have friended you--you're just wasting [...]
your time. and even if, miraculously, they do see your ping, what if they'd rather not ping you, like if they're busy working on something private? you won't hear back from [...]
then either, as there's no way to decline a ping except by ignoring it, and possibly keeping them waiting. so what were we talking about? oh yeah, locking people. i couldn't [...]
more here: please, please *say something* first, before you with no warning leave them unable to talk to you about it. [âœ“]
